snippet: Flooding in the western province of Sichuan was the worst in 50 years for some areas, with more than 220,000 people forced to evacuate.
abstract: Floodwaters sweep Himalayan foothills in western China, destroying bridges and houses and leaving at least 31 people dead and 166 missing.
lead_paragraph: Flooding in the western province of Sichuan was the worst in 50 years for some areas, with more than 220,000 people forced to evacuate.

headline.main: Floods Leave Dozens Dead in China
